channel.title: Leased Lines on 0x000216

item.title: Dedicated Leased Lines for Business
item.description: By: John Shepler Leased lines, a technology dating back to the telegraph, have evolved to offer businesses speeds ranging from 1.5 Mbps to 100 Gbps. Let’s delve into the characteristics of leased lines and how they stand apart from conventional broadband. What is a Leased Line? Similar to leasing a property, leased lines involve an agreement and regular payments that grant you exclusive access to a dedicated communication line. In its simplest form, a leased line consists of a pair of copper wires, linking your location to your provider, often through a local telephone company (ILEC).
